intro: Blepharodon triviale, commonly known as the common blepharodon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in some regions.
